name: niml_feedme
author: AFNI Developers
description: Sends volumes from the dataset to AFNI via the NIML socket interface.

inputs.description: Send data, via TCP/IP, to AFNI running on the computer system 'sname'. By default, uses the current system (localhost), if you don't use this option.
inputs.name: Host

inputs.description: Tries to maintain an inter-transmit interval of 'ms' milliseconds. The default is 1000 msec per volume.
inputs.name: Inter-transmit Interval

inputs.description: Send sub-bricks so that they accumulate in AFNI. The default is to create only a 1 volume dataset inside AFNI, and each sub-brick just replaces that one volume when it is received.
inputs.name: Accumulate Flag

inputs.description: Change the dataset name transmitted to AFNI from 'niml_feedme' to 'nam'.
inputs.name: Target Dataset Name

inputs.description: Send 'cmd' as a DRIVE_AFNI command. If cmd contains blanks, it must be in 'quotes'. Multiple -drive options may be used. These commands will be sent to AFNI just after the first volume is transmitted. See file README.driver for a list of commands.
inputs.name: Drive AFNI Commands

inputs.description: Input dataset to be sent to AFNI.
inputs.name: Input dataset
